name: Hotel Antiche Figure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel, great value. Alessandro was "the host with the most "- Gianni too. Very helpful! This hotel is across from the train station - make sure that when you head down to St. Mark's square and the Rialto - that you take the "82" vaporetto not "1" - 82 makes less stops, Vaporetto #1stops at every stop. It took us a good 35 minutes on #1 to get back to the hotel from St. Mark's square (took us 2 days to figure this one out) Buon Viaggio!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just arrived home after a lovely weekend at the Antiche. All the good things said by previous reviewers are true. Location perfect - not near S.Marco but we liked the walk or the vaporetto ride and being away from the crowds was an advantage. The hotel staff were so pleasant and helpful and arranged tickets for the secret tour and gave excellent advice on Murano and gondolas. We also loved their restaurant recommendation - very simple style but excellent fresh food and very attentive service. we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. We booked a canal view room (212) which was perfect and we were not disturbed by noise, it was great to watch all the traffic going by outside. Thank you Antiche and Venice for a lovely weekend.
reviews.title: You're right - it really is nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only one night and one long day in April 2007.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was very good for what we wanted. It was located right on the Grand Canal but quite west right across the Scalzi Bridge. It is across the canal from the train station and a 7 minute walk from Piazzelle Roma. We arrived very early in the morning having just left a cruise ship. We did not expect to be able to get our room so early and were prepared to stash our bags and run. However, the woman at the front desk had knowledge of us from our email correspondence and told us to wait in the breakfast room and that she would send the housekeeper up immediately to do our room. She gave us the hotel brochure, circled the windows of our room and in a 1/2 hour we were in the room. All this before 9:30 am. The view from our room was breathtaking. The service otherwise was very helpful and warm. We would stay here again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — the view of the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in the San Croce area right near a vaporetto stop. The breakfast was good, free internet access with a cable they supply. Bathroom with little crystal chandeliers, toothbruses and other nice ammenities.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Excellent Location and friendly staff
reviews.text: Lovely hotel on the Grand Canal. Staff were very welcoming and on our arrival gave us lots of useful information about places to go and what to do during our stay. Room was nicely decorated and clean, the bathroom was also very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was ideally situated just across the bridge from the Vaporettas which took you into the centre of the city at regular intervals.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Shower in the room got water all over the bathroom floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again most definitely!
reviews.title: Warm, friendly Hotel

likes.liked: — The nice rooms and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a family of four that stayed at this hotel for two nights in March. The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely nice. This is a great location for those that arrive by train, the hotel is right across the canal from the train station. We had a little trouble with the shower getting water all over the bathroom floor, but were very satisfied with everything else.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from our second trip to Italy, and our second stay at the Antiche Figure Hotel in Venice. The first trip, we relyed on Hotels.com to help us find a good hotel, and we were so pleased with this wonderful, little hotel.
reviews.title: Perfection !

likes.liked: — Location and friendliness of staff - oh and the free internet access !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Antiche Figure lived up to all the excellent reviews I read here. I had friends who stayed here in Feb. 2006 who also raved, so I felt confident in my choice. The staff is superb (that means you Francesca and Alessandro!) and the facilty clean, charming and top-notch. Our room and bathroom were plush, stately and refined (a wonderful king size bed). This 3-star hotel makes some 4-stars look shabby. We had a 4th floor room with large windows overlooking the rooftops of Venice- beautiful, and seemed quieter than the front Grand Canal rooms. The breakfast served was great as well. I wish I was sitting at a cafe table outside the front of the hotel, sipping a latte and watching the city wake up on the Grand Canal right now!
reviews.title: It Lives Up to the Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was concerned that the location might be too far away from "the action", but trust me, it's perfect. When arriving (and leaving) Venice via train or bus or taxi, walking to the hotel with your luggager is a breeze. And the 20 minute walk from the hotel to the sights closer to St Mark's, Rialto or Accademia bridges is nothing short of fabulous. You'll be glad to have a hotel away from the crowds and mayhem. I know Rick Steves writes that staying by the train station isn't so great but I disagree. My partner and I discovered charming, uncrowded areas as we walked to and from the hotel: Campo San Giacomo dell' Orio, Campo Santa Margherita and Campo San Barnaba. Walking across the Scalza Bridge into the Cannaregio "Ghetto" district in the evenings was magical: great restuarants, shops, bakeries and gelato stands.
reviews.title: Highy recommended
LovelyAntiche
reviews.text: Pretty much perfect in every way - friendly, helpful staff, spotlessly clean room, elegant decor, good breakfast, good location. Can't say much more than that!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006
reviews.text: We had been to Italy before but not Venice. We selected it due to the closeness to the train station and it was on the main canal. The hotel is beautiful, wonderful view of the canal, away from the St. Marco crowds and noise but it is a wonderful walk to get to the square.
reviews.title: Excellent room and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Alessandro, Francesca, Gianni are the most wonderful, friendly and charming people. They were very gracious and extremely helpful. They provided us with the best place to eat on a little side street near the hotel. After returning home, all 3 helped me with finding a speical gift for my husband that I was unable to get while in Venice. They went way beyond the call of their jobs. Hotel Antiche is the only place I would ever stay when we return to Venice. One of a kind in all areas of hotel stay.
reviews.title: Truly Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my 5th stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure in 5 years. The location can not be beat and it is lovely to see so many of the same staff year after year. As is our custom we reserved a room with a view of the Grand Canal. This visit Anka seemed to be on desk duty whenever we needed restaurant reservations or suggestions. She did a great job taking care of us and our stay was excellent. We came to Venice by air and took a water taxi to the hotel. We left for Florence via the train.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is a helpful tip: for 5 Euro per bag, the hotel will arrange for a porter to pick up the bags and put them on a cart and get them all the way to the train station and up the steps. It was well worth the cost for the 4 of us (two couples) not to have to manage our bags going over the very steep bridge next to the station. I'm not sure how I had missed this service on our previous trips but it is worth noting!
reviews.title: Our second visit as good as the first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here again for 3 days before our cruise. We had stayed here in 2009 and had such a good stay, we decided to return. Originally, availability was only for 2 nights, then we would have to stay in their sister hotel for the last night. At check-in, I asked if it was possible to stay there the full 3 nights so we wouldn't have to move. Evidently, there had been a cancellation, so we could stay. After a long flight from Philadelphia, a bus ride from the airport to Piazzale Roma, and a 2 bridge walk to the hotel, we only had to wait 30 minutes to check in to our room. Breakfast was what we remembered with cappaccino, meats, cheese, rolls, croissants, pastries, boiled eggs, yogurt, juices, tea and coffee being available. We cannot say enough about the friendliness and the helpfulness of everyone. Thank you Allesandro and staff. (Note: I noticed the Trip Advisor sticker at check-in.)
reviews.title: Trip to venice by disabled person

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Antiche Figure is a reasonably priced mid range hotel at a good location for public transport in Venice. It is opposite the Rialway Station (bridge across canal) not far from the main bus Station and there is a Vaperetto (water bus stop) nearby. You can alos exit the back of the hotel quickly into the back streets of Venice, which, if you are able bodied is an easily 'walkable' city. If you are disabled use the Vaperreto staff will help. The staff at this hotel were extremely pleasant and helpful. Because I am a wheelchair user the upgraded me to a larger room at no extra cost. This is an old Venetian building hich has been furnished in a modern/venetial style. It was lovely especailly the bedroom. It was clean ith all facilities and an excellent mid range cost hotel bearing in mind that Venice like most cities is extremely expensive. If you want a bit of luxury on a budget this is a good one to use.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon this October and were welcomed like family into this hotel. They had a beautiful flower arrangement in our room and a fantastic bottle of champagne waiting for us upon checking in. All the staff were so accommodating and helped us find places to eat and recommended sights and things to do during our stay. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal which was absolutely beautiful! Breakfast every morning was a delicious assortment of meats, cheeses and pastries along with cold cereal and fresh juice. Our favorite thing was ordering a cappuccino that they made to order at no charge. They even went above and beyond and arranged a day trip to the Murano glass factory with transportation there and back and a tour of the factory for free! They truly made our time in Venice memorable and if we make it back we will definitely be staying there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful start to our European vacation
Perfect in every way
reviews.text: Booked this hotel because of the excellent reviews and discovered they were well deserved. We stayed one night pre-cruise and it proved an excellent choice in every way. We took airport express to P.Roma (3 euros) which is about 100 metres from hotel. Two bridges to cross and even with heavy cases ( well we were cruising), we managed no problem.

reviews.title: Enhanced the Venetian experience
reviews.text: We were on the top floor in a deluxe room with 3 windows over looking the grand canal and it was brill - found it amazing watching all the activity on the canal and loved the elaborate decor - a nice change from modern hotel chains.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and provided us with a map of Venice. We preferred just to wander as there were plenty of signs for P.Marco, Rialto Bridge and P. Roma so we never got lost. We found St Marks easily and jumped on the waterbus there. It sailed right up the grand canal, dropping us off opposite the hotel at the station.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, few quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For anyone planning to cruise from Venice then this hotel is perfect. Shuttle buses leave from P Roma to Cruise Terminal and as we had an afternoon flight post-cruise, the hotel kept our luggage to give us another morning in Venice.
reviews.title: Fabulous Fiftieth!!

likes.disliked: — No view from window, but not a major drawback

reviews.title: great service
reviews.text: Fantastic location, great staff, lovely room - definitely recommend for a short stay in Venice.

reviews.title: some specifics
reviews.text: I agree that the location is a plus. But you should know that walking over the bridge to and from the train station is not the cinch that some seem to imply. The bridge that you need to cross is high and there are steps to climb up and down. Also, as Rick Steve points out in his guide book: staying in this area you are constantly jostling with a lot of people hauling their luggage to and from the train station. It's not a big detriment but still something to take into consideration.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, this area is not known for great restaurants and as has been pointed out you need to take the vaporetto to go to the main tourist attractions.
reviews.title: A Venetian Gem

likes.liked: — The attitude of the hotel employees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't mean to ding the hotel but its internet connection in the room is ethernet only. However, there is good wireless access downstairs in the lobby. The breakfast buffet is not something that I will remember with fond memory.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel, great room, great location great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have not stayed in other hotels in Venice and perhaps by comparison this place is a gem, but for the money I pay I would expect a lot more elsewhere.
reviews.title: A Good Choice in Venice

likes.liked: — Front desk staff, AC after a hot day, proximity to Train Station
likes.disliked: — Stuffing 3 beds in a 2 person room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Antiche Figure and the people who work in this hotel made our stay in Venice memorable. From check in to check out they could not have been more accomodating. Alessandro was an absoute pleasure to deal with. His recommendations for activities, restaurants, and sight seeing were par excellance! Our room was clean and had a great view of the Grand Canal with easy access to the train station. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel for a future visit to Venice.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: We had a king bed on the top floor facing the Grand Canal. The front desk staff was wonderful. The location of the hotel is close to everything. Breakfast was included. Booked through Expedia.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small charming hotel
reviews.title: Great location
Room Change otherwise very good
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Antiche Figure for three nights during our honeymoon and found it to be the perfect hotel for a stay in one of the most romantic cities in the world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: While the hotel is located on the opposite end of all the attractions (St. Mark's Square, Doge's Palace, etc.), it was nice to be near the quieter part of the city, but yet still be on the Grand Canal. Plus, Venice is so small we had fun just walking to places like St. Mark's, being that it would only take about 20-25 minutes to walk there (And who doesn't love walking through Venetian cobblestone streets!)
reviews.title: Great location and service!

likes.liked: — the staff, location and view from the room and the cleeanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was a 5 minute walk to both the ATV (water bus) and to Piazzale Roma, which is where we had to pick up the shuttle to the cruise we were taking from Venice. To get to the airport you can either, very easily, take the ATV to the airport or pick up an actual taxi (driven) from Piazzale Roma, which is connected by bridge to the mainland.
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.liked: — Beautiful clean rooms and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Antiche Figure is fully deserving of the praise it receives on this site. We thought the location was ideal - if you are carrying even a little bit of luggage, the steps and bridges of Venice can be a nightmare. Antiche Figure is steps away from the train station - cross one bridge and there you are. It is also close to some wonderful parts of Venice that are less touristy, such as Santa Croce.
reviews.title: This place is fabulous!

likes.liked: — The service was great; the hotel is beautiful; the location is perfect.
likes.disliked: — Nothing bad to say about it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely room with a canal view. The room was done in a classic Venetian style and looked pretty glam overall. We had no problems with canal noise, as the windows are likely soundproofed and had substantial shutters. The bathroom was spacious. There was plenty of closet space and a large desk in the room. They serve breakfast in a very nice dining area just off of the lobby. They made us a cappuccino every morning and the breakfast was quite good.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The thing that makes this hotel a true gem is the service. The staff could not have been more helpful. The made dinner reservations for us, and then re-arranged them to accommodate the changes in weather so we could dine outside. One staff member actually remembered where we were having dinner one evening and took the time to ask us about it. They were also excellent about providing directions, which is a much needed service in a place like Venice. As we were checking out on our way to Florence, another member of the hotel staff gave us dining suggestions and even a few menu choices! These people are a class act.
reviews.title: Wonderful small Hotel with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: I would absolutely stay at Antiche Figure again - bravo!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was perfect for a honeymooner and first time visitor to Venice. Venice can be intimidating for a first time visitor, trying to navigate bridges and canals without having to resort to water taxis that can cost 80 Euros one way. This hotel is conveniently located on the grand canal right across from the train station. We crossed the bridge, and there it was (this was perfect since it was raining and we had luggage). We had a lovely top floor room overlooking the canal. This is a very charming hotel, with only 12 rooms, perfect for the honeymooner!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room and bathroom were both beautiful and incredibly spotless. Everyone working at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The breakfast staff even made us fresh cappucinos upon request each morning.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay in Venice
A charming and convenient Hotel
reviews.text: We loved the location of the hotel as well. It's directly across from the train station and a short walk from the bus terminal for easy access traveling to and from Venice. While the hotel is a distance from St. Mark's Square, we found that to be a plus as it's less congested and allowed us to explore the enchanting alleys of Venice.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Travel tip: Large suitcases are difficult to maneuver on the stairs of bridges in Venice. Suggest travelers to Venice pack light if walking to their hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure 14-16 Sep 07 mainly based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: The Perfect Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Antiche Figure for 3 nights at the beginning of December. It was our first time in Venice and we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. We chose the hotel based on the recommendations of this site and we were very happy with our selection. The staff are very helpful in all respects and went out of their way to ensure that we enjoyed our stay They made good recommendations for dinner and gave helpful travel and sightseeing advice. We had Room 211 which was a large room with a small balcony and a lovely view over the Grand Canal. It had a really nice bathroom, with marble floors, his and hers basins and even a bidet. It was also useful having a minibar fridge in the room to store small food items. Our room had a safe for any valuables.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Antiche Figure

likes.liked: — Friendly service, Positioned for great views over the Grand Canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is superb if you are travelling into Venice by bus. It is literally a 5 minute walk from the main bus terminal at Piazalle Roma. With its location directly opposite the Rail terminal (Ferrovia), it is easy to find after your days sightseeing. The vaporetto (water bus) is less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel and will take you to Rialto and St Marco in less than 20 and 40 minutes respectively. Its really easy to walk around Venice as it is very flat, so we appreciated Francesca's advice to only buy a vaporetto ticket for one day for 12 Euros.
reviews.title: The Grand Canal with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought that the breakfast was great, with cereals, fruits, cold meats, yoghurts, hard boiled eggs, biscuits and plenty more! The lady serving breakfast is very sweet (sorry I don't know her name) and helpful. It was good having access to the internet in the lobby.
reviews.title: Relaxing Atmosphere, clean tidy and helpful

likes.disliked: — Having to go home and get the old nose back to the grindstone so I can afford another holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would not hesitate to book this hotel again when I return to Venice. For those of you who are still thinking about whether to stay here, don't waste any more time looking elsewhere -just book here - you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Great Room, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a small hotel with character and friendly staff. The location is convenient and centralized. It sits right on the bank of the Grand Canal across from the train station. The walk to the hotel from the train station is about 150 yards over a bride of stairs (that lack a ramp or handicap access). Neither my wife nor I are handicapped, but I sure felt immobile after dragging 5 luggage bags up and over the stairs. In Venice, you apparently have to have a license to transport luggage or goods over a certain distance. Our options were to take the water Taxi across the 10 yards (I could literately throw a rock at the hotel) of water to the other side for 35 Euros or drag the luggage over the bridge. As you can tell I am still happy about it.
reviews.title: Loved the position and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previously stayed 3 nights in '09 - we were so impressed with this hotel we returned for a two night stay. Previously booked based upon TA reviews which have remained constant and consistent in the intervening years. Service, cleanliness, friendliness of the reception team cannot be faulted. As others have pointed out the location is ideally located close to the rail and bus terminals as well as car parks. The hotel will stamp your park park voucher to enable you to benefit from a 10 percent discount.
reviews.title: Return visit - quality of service remains 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If your budget allows opt for a canal view room at the front of the hotel overlooking the Grand Canal - the view of the passing water traffic is just amazing. If/when we return to beautiful Venice, we will return to the Antiche Figure.
reviews.title: Best customer service, and the location is perfect too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at a lot of hotels across Italy and in the US and Antiche Figure really stood out with some of the best customer service. There were three of us traveling and not only did they upgrade us to a suite just because it was available, the staff really went out of their way to answer questions, help with bags, make reservations, tell us about the city, etc. They couldn't possibly make us feel more at home. The breakfast was pretty extensive with free flowing cappuccinos.
reviews.title: Room with a view, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is great being near the train station. At first we were worried we were too far from the center of Venice but after a few quiet dinners in the neighborhood (which the hotel recommended and were amazing!) and a short walk to the bus station, we realized we lucked out with the perfect location.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its no wonder why they're so well rated on Trip Advisor!
reviews.title: Good location, great coffee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent little hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent, very friendly and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my boyfriend in March 2007 for a romantic getaway and it was ideal. The staff couldnt be any more helpful and the location was to die for, right on the grande canal!
reviews.title: Fantastic, Friendly Hotel

likes.liked: — Friendly relaxed atmosphere in agreat location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldnt ask for more out of a hotel - superb.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — Staff, location, room, breakfast . . . . just about everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a night stay in this excellent hotel. We've stayed there three times on three seperate occasions, and will deffinately stay here again the next time we're back in Venice. It's location is great for ease of access to the Bus Terminal, Train Station (directly opposite) and the majority of the major Vaporetto routes. There's a Gondola pick up point right outside too, which if you ask at the reception desk they can get you a discount. If you plan to visit Murano to see the glass blowing factories, It's also worth asking at reception as they can get you a free taxi ride to one of the factories on the island with no obligation to purchase anything.
reviews.title: Absolutely The Best!

likes.disliked: — No wirelss internet in the suite, but it is planned for installation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Of the three rooms that we've had, they've all been fantastic. Spacious by european standards, fully air conditioned and with a well appointed bathroom. Breakfast isn't included (I believe) in the normal price, but they do a deal with those that have booked through expedia (and maybe other online agencies) of a continental style buffet breakfast for €5. I think that's great value, as you'd be hard pressed to find this price anywhere else.
reviews.title: Loved Venice and Hotel Antiche Figure!!

likes.liked: — Watching the action of the Grand Canal from my room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved this hotel!! It was our first trip to Venice and this hotel was the perfect ending to each beautiful day of exploring the city and sampling the wonderful food and wines. We had a canal view room with three large windows that was very tastefully furnished and spacious. The breakfast each morning was a pleasant way to start the day and the outdoor cafe tables were a enjoyable place for an afternoon drink or just a nice place to observe the canal and people walking by. The staff were tremendous from the minute we walked through the front door until the minute we left. Very helpful with directions (they provided a detailed map of Venice and a guidebook) and were very courteous and friendly. Hotel Antiche Figure will become our hotel of choice for future visits to Venice and a nice recommendation to our friends. DiMuzio Family, Beaconsfield, UK
reviews.title: Unforgettable Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007
reviews.text: This hotel was fabulous. It is right next to the train station, water busses etc. The rooms were big, comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was good. The staff were fantastic. Definetly worth the stay.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a great stay first week of april. staff before and during were very friendly and informative. The location is great, i just dont get
reviews.title: great place great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the gripes of some earlier reviews, i thought the view overlooking the canal was great...so there is a train station on the other side.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only gripes would be limited breakfast and the 3rd bed to make our room a triple wasnt the most comfortable in the world but everybody were agreed that they enjoyed their stay.
reviews.title: Easter break in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending 3 weeks of planning for this anniversary trip and reading 100's of reviews i finally picked this hotel to stay in whilst in Venice. I was looking for 4 or 5 star hotels but none of the reviews were as good as this hotel.
reviews.title: The best hotel

likes.liked: — clean and the deco was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were fluent in english and were always willing to help. The room was beautiful and the view of the canal was wonderful.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: On Arrival at the aiport we took a bus which costs us only 3 euros each this was dirt cheap compared to a water taxi which was 100 euros or a normal taxi which was 70 euros and the bus ride was only 15 minutes away. It stopped at one stop only which was the Santa Lucia station and from there the hotel was only a 5 minute walk.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel all-around

likes.liked: — The rooms were amazing and the staff cannot be beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Across the hotel was the waterbus stop where we could access all areas of Venice like the Rialto Bridge, St. Marks Sqaure etc.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone.
reviews.title: Karen and John Adamthwaite, Newcastle, NSW Australia - Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise. Superb location 5 minutes walk from the Piazzale Roma, the area where the airport buses arrive, the main carparks & the walkway to the cruise terminal. To get to the hotel means walking across two canal bridges. The main railway station is on the opposite side to the hotel. The hotel is situated right on the Grand Canal. Can't beat the location its really just fantastic watching the boats on the bustling canal.
reviews.title: fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lovely warm welcome from the staff, full of ideas on how to get the most from the city.In fact as has been reported many times the staff really are very helpful and make this hotel the special place it is & its deserved high ranking on Trip Advisor..
reviews.title: Perfect location for our family of 5!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was located in a separate building 25m down an alleyway to the side of the main hotel. We were on the second floor and our room was spotlessly clean, 4 poster bed, nice furniture, large bathroom with powerful shower, & a well stocked hospitality tray. A slight criticism was a lack of storage space.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel, wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several rooms in the main building must have fabulous views over the canal.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was taken in the small dining room, or in the bar area or outside overlooking the canal. Again a warm welcome each morning, its relaxed and informal. Plenty of choice with juices, cereal, fruit, pastries, meats, cheese & wonderful coffee. There was also a small bar for an evening drink & sitting outside with a glass of wine watching the people and boats is just so relaxing.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Stayed three nights with my wife for our 25th anniversary. It was away from the hustle of San Marco and Rialto but right by two water taxi stops. Great spot for arriving and departing Venice. It is just across from the train station and about 7 minutes walk from the bus station(rode bus to airport). I don't know if I could find other hotels that were farther into town as this wa our first visit to Venice.
reviews.title: Excellent location for Venice
Excellent Location!
reviews.text: The hotel staff was superior. Provided all the useful help about what to see and how to get there. Breakfast was super! The room was large and the bathroom was the largest we had while in Italy.

reviews.title: this hotel is second to none!
reviews.text: I don't know whatelse we could have asked for from a hotel. We were very pleased with the price, room, service and value we received. We were treated extremely well by everyone. We would stay here again and would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.title: Very happy with our experience
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Antiche Figure for three nights in early May. Our room was on the first floor (one above street level) , was quite large and overlooked the canal. It's a busy location, so if you don't like street noise (voices, laughter, gondolas - no cars!) ask for a room either higher up or off the canal. The location across the canal from the train station was great - except for lugging our bags up the bridge stairs. Oh well. The staff was great - Francesca especially. Breakfast was fine, except for the coffee from the automatic machine in the dining room. AVOID IT if you consider yourself a coffee lover. Ask the staff to make you an espresso or americano from the real machine at the bar. Trust me. Oh, and try the little cafe down the alley adjacent to the hotel - the cafe right next to the laundry facility. They make excellent sandwiches!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: What can I say - the best hotel I ever stayed in. I've been to Tokyo, London, Rome, Sydney and nothing compares to the service and genuinely friendly and helpful atmosphere in this hotel. My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in early April purely on the strength of the reviews and comments on this site. From the moment we arrived we were treated so well it was unbelievable. We realised that maybe our experience wouldnt be quiet as good as everyone who posted here, but we were blissfully wrong.
reviews.title: Brilliant little hotel
Wonderful Staff and location
reviews.text: This hotel on the Grand Canal was beutifully decorated, comfortable and close to the many attractions in Venice. The staff helped in every way possible, from trips to the outlying islands to good restaurants near the hotel. We were able to get a top floor room facing the canal and the activity there and along the promenade great fun to watch. The hotel is quiet but from 7:30 am onward the canal gets very busy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walking or taking the vaporeto to get arounfd the city was easy and convenient and a boat trip to a Murano glass furnce was arranged at no cost. Fabulous looking glassware and artistic pieces on the island.
reviews.title: Friendly Antiche Figure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff at Antiche Figure were outstanding in their efforts to make our stay memorable but the informallity of the place was welcome as well. It definitely felt like "home" and we would stay again.
reviews.title: Little gem on the Grand Canal

likes.liked: — Location, cleanliness and hospitality of staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 3-night stay at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice, and were extremely impressed wirh the Hotel. It is situated on the Grand Canal, and is within easy reach of bus and train stations, as well as being close to vaporetta stops, making it easy to get around Venice. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we were always greeted with a smile. When we arrived at the hotel, a member of staff gave us a map, and spent about 10 minutes giving us useful information, such as how to use the local transport, things to do and see, and where to eat. As a result, we were able to make the most of our stay in Venice, and felt very comfortable about asking for information as and when we needed it.
reviews.title: We would love to return to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading Trip Advisor's comments about this hotel I decided to book this for our 20th Wedding Anniversary. I am so glad I did!!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back to the Antiche Figure!

likes.liked: — A fantastic location with a friendly atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic! Just 5 minutes walk away from the bus station and over the bridge to the train station and water bus, the hotel enabled us to get around Venice very easily.
reviews.title: A Terrifice Venice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We upgraded to the Deluxe room which was lovely as it was a huge room, tastefully decorated (feel the fabric on the walls) and the bed was massive! Francesca and Alessandro were most helpful in recommending places to eat and the best way to get around and places to see.There was a lot of choice for breakfast. Breadrolls, meats, cheeses, eggs, fruit, yogurts, cereals, croissants and cake. Also tea, coffee, juice and milk.
reviews.title: What a find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We bought a 72 hour ticket for the water taxi and found we got value for money doing this. Most days we caught the number 83 watertaxi to the Rialto bridge and followed the signs "Per S Marco". This took us through all the lovely streets to St Mark's Square. Spend time there and soak up the atmosphere, it was truly amazing! Go to the roof of St Mark's and see the four horses, we could have spent ages up there admiring the views.
reviews.title: Very Friendly Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel recently. Absolutely loved it. It is has everyone on the reviews has mentioned wonderful. The staff are friendly and can't be more helpful. we had a small room which by other standards really wasn't that small. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Close to where the Ryan Air bus stops and within walking distance of all the major sites.
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Again Fab hotel
reviews.title: Unbelievably good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It is beautifully decorated, and a five minute walk away from the train station and bus terminal. Breakfast was not included with our acccomodation, but they have a deal with Hotels.com that offers a buffet breakfast for €5. This was a great deal, it was self service, which meant unlimited coffee, tea, cereal, juices, crossaints, bread rolls, fruit, ham,cheese, yoghurts etc. It was a really fantastic experience staying here, and the staff were so helpful and friendly. Please take my advice and stay here if you are planning a trip to Venice, you really won't regret it!
reviews.title: A Wonderful End to a Dream Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is in a beautiful historical building near the beginning of the Grand Canal. It is just a 5 minute walk from Piazzale Roma (where you first begin your journey into Venice if going by car). Remember that if you have a lot of luggage you will have to pass over two bridges with stairs to get to the hotel so pack light or bring strong arms. When compared to any other hotel in Venice, however, two bridges to cross is nothing! The hotel is within a 30 minute walk to San Marco Square and there is a really nice area with shops just around the corner from the hotel as well.
reviews.title: Our dream came true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accomodations were spotless and spacious and I didn't have a Canal view room. The bathroom was beautifully done in marble and murano glass.
reviews.title: Solid hotel for quick visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: With some trepidation we arrived at the AF with our 2 friends early in a 5 week combined 30th wedding anniversay European tour. Would our friends find the hotel OK after assuring them that all my research said it would be? It was and they did! In fact it was much better than 'OK' and truly deserves its high Trip Advisor rating.
reviews.title: We will come again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Arriving by train and with 5 weeks worth of luggage including formal wear for the upcoming Mediterranean cruise, our only surprise was the steps on the bridge that separates the hotel and the station. We had imagined a smooth surface to glide the wheels over and had to carry them.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Glad we took your advice !
Loved this Hotel and its Staff
reviews.text: Over 3 nights we stayed in the canal view rooms and smaller ones down the side. All have fairly recently been fitted out, and were clean. The welcome by John was friendly and the restaurant recommendation excellent. The female party members' already high estimation of the hotel climbed even higher when they met Alessandro next day - so charming, so handsome, so helpful! Location was fine and we walked or vaporettoed everywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel AF for 4 nights at the beginning of June 2006 (2 adults + teenage son) and we can highly recommend it. The hotel itself is small but spotlessly clean with very hard working staff who make you feel very welcome. We met Alessandro the manager and Francesa who gave us lots of advice to make our trip enjoyable.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: We had an excellant room (211) with a large double and a single bed, large marble bathroom and small balcony. We really enjoyed watching the world go by from the balcony - either standing on it or sitting in our room at the open balcony door with our feet up after a hard days sight seeing. The mini bar prices for water (2 euro) beer (4 euro) were about 80 cents higher than in shops but a cold beer in the comfort of your own room was worth it. We saw other hotels that we had been tempted to book but were very relieved that we hadn't as none of them had a prime spot on the grand canal like the AF, so our advice is to look no further than this hotel. It's location by the bus / train stations is ideal and despite being on the canal side once the shutters were closed at night there was no noise preventing a good nights sleep - especially after a lovely hot chocolate in the bar.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the last day of our honeymoon we were confirmed to stay with the Hotel Antiche Figure. We arrived and they told us that we were a no show. There was a disconnect between the hotel and travel agent. They accomodated us by putting us in a private apartment. It was down at the end of an alley. Spray painted wall. Once inside we had no hot water, no phone, no alarm clock, and a bug zapper. As I read in bed I had bugs on my shirt. I'd think twice about this place. Management was not very friendly, but since we pre-paid they knew they must accomodate.
reviews.title: Lousy

likes.liked: — That it was across from the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are 2 seniors from Australia who just spent 4 weeks travelling by train through southern Germany, Austria, Slovenia and northern Italy. All of our accommodation was booked online, but our 3 night stay at Hotel Antiche Figure was the best. First of all the hotel was easy to find since it is located directly across the Grand Canal from the main train station. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and told our room was ready, but a newly-renovated suite nearby was offered for the same price. We opted for the beautifully decorated suite with a living area, kitchenette, large bedroom with canopy bed and complete bathroom with all mod-cons. Breakfast was served each morning in the main hotel. The manager and his staff spoke perfect English. Nearby restaurants, patronized by the locals, were recommended. Advice on the ferries and sightseeing hints were given. Even a water taxi ride and guided tour through one of the glass factories on Murano Island were arranged for us with 15 minutes notice. We could not have wished for a more pleasant stay.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent service, charming impeccable fairy-tale rooms, marble bathrooms, great location on the Grand Canal within walking distance of Piazzalle Roma. Would highly recommend. You can walk to Rialto bridge in 15 minutes and St. Marks Square in about 20 -25 minutes or take the Vaporetto which takes 30-40 minutes. They serve a good continental breakfast downstairs and you can take your breakfast outside and eat along the canal if it's nice. The train station is just across the canal and you can cross the bridge and walk through the Jewish Ghetto for some of the best pizza in Venice. Perfect for pre or post cruise as it's so close to the cruise port.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: II guess all the preceding reviews some up this little gem of a hotel in Venice.
reviews.title: A little Gem in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked one of the suites which are in a separate building about 30 meters away from the hotel. The standard of furnishing and comfort are excellent and they are quiet being off the Grand Canal, views from these rooms are limited. The suites are well equipped, with kitchen and seating area and bedroom and bathroom. They are small, but not unusual for a city and OK for a few days which is the usual case. So if you are after a view of the Grand Canal book in to the main hotel. The breakfast is served in the main hotel and reasonably good. The staff are all helpful and will provide any information or assistance you require. The location is ideal if you are arriving or leaving by road or rail and convenient for the Vapporato. This is good value, and quality accommodation for Venice.
reviews.title: Perfect. WILL return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I do not normally write reviews about the hotels we stay in but the Hotel Antiche Figure was so good I just had to let everyone know.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel

likes.liked: — Service of staff and quality of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the end of extended European holiday to spend our last night in Venice at the Antiche Figure. After 6 weeks of hotels we thought this would just be the same as the rest. Fortunately we soon found out this was not the case. The staff were absolutely wonderful, their service was excellent and most importantly they made you feel as if we were at home.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay at the Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a deluxe room overlooking the grand canal, it was a blue room and was beautifully furnished. We loved some of the little things that our room had, such as the coffee and tea
reviews.title: I wanted to stay longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: facilities in the room, something very rare in Italian hotel rooms.
reviews.title: 100% Satisfied!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was a generous size with more than usual amenities and of course it was fitted with beautiful marble and murano glass lighting.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Would be nice to have cooked breakfast option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here one night on 21 September. The room was lovely, service wonderful, and the freshly brewed cappacino to die for. We took the shuttle from the airport to Piazalle Roma and took the short walk to the hotel. I will warn you, there are two bridges with steep steps that you have to go over. If you have heavy luggage, try carrying it up a flight of stairs to see if you want to try this. Thankfully, two young men approached as we started up the first bridge and offered to carry our luggage for us. I tipped 5 Euro for carrying two suitcases over the two bridges and they seemed pleased. The hotel arranged for a porter service to carry our luggage to the people mover in Piazalle Roma as we left for our cruise ship. The charge was 5 Euro per bag.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 3 nights from 13 Oct, which was about right to do the things we wanted on our 1st visit to Venice. Met by the charming and extremely helpful Francesca at reception, who is a mine of information and for whom nothing is too much trouble.
reviews.title: First class service, brilliant location for station/Piazalle Roma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were offered and accepted an upgrade (FOC) to a suite, which was lovely and down a quiet alley next to the hotel.
reviews.title: Easy to access via car or train and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived by train from Florence ( easy journey, booked on the day 2hrs, 45 euro) and the hotel is directly opposite Venice SL station. we left on the airport bus (6 euro)from P Roma which is a 5 minute walk. Weather was wet for significant part of our stay and eves are cold.
reviews.title: I will never stay anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel can arrange a free trip to Murano by water taxi, which is worth doing for the ride alone, though the prices for the glass are much higher than even the San Marco square shops. A free water taxi to San Marco from Murano completed the visit.
reviews.title: Very special hotel property in a special city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a week stopping in room 412 which was spacious, beautifully decorated and furnished, very clean and had three windows giving wonderful views over the Grand Canal. Nice touches in the room such as slippers and bathrobes together with sweets and a well stocked mini bar. Bathroom was lovely too and quite luxurious. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful. A special mention to the lovely waitress at breakfast who always greeted us with a smile. Breakfast was far better than we had been expecting. Useful to have internet access available in the lobby. Hotel is perfectly situated and easy to find when you get lost wandering around the side streets, there are plenty of signs pointing the way to Ferrovia which is the train station opposite the hotel or the Plaza Roma. Just a short walk over the bridge to shops and restaurants. When we checked out we were asked for any suggestions on how the hotel can improve its service but we really haven't got any, everything was perfect for us and we would definitely stop here again. Thanks to everyone at the Hotel Antiche Figure for a wonderful holiday.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, cleanliness and decoration of hotel, location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor - and am glad to report that everything good that I read is true. We stayed for just two nights precruise. The hotel is a short walk from Piazzale Roma over two small bridges, right opposite the train station. The staff are as friendly and welcoming as everyone has said. We were offered a choice of rooms and chose the smaller room with the 'view' of the canal.
reviews.title: Fantastic little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The restaurant that the hotel recommended was so good that we went there two nights running - Osteria al Vecio Pozzo just a few streets behind the hotel. Good cooking and the house 'white' wine [which is really a Prosecco] slid down easily at €13.50 a litre! Another very good restaurant we found was in San Tome Square right by the San Tome stop on the Grand Canal. Tables set up outside the church in a quiet area of town - well worth it.
reviews.title: Loved the Antiche Figure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One reviewer was moaning that this hotel was not near St Marks Square and I can only say thank goodness it wasn't ,as that area was absolutely heaving with tourists, and the restaurants that we tried in the area were not as good and charged considerably more!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good, ask for a proper cappucino instead of using the machine [no extra cost], and they are happy to serve drinks until the small hours in the small area outside!
reviews.title: Simply superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hope you get your #1 rating on TripAdvisor back soon!
reviews.title: Super Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a Mediterranean cruise and stayed at Antiche Figure for 2 nights before the departure of the Emerald Princess from Venice. Once flying into Venice we took the ACTO bus to Piazza Roma. The bus is right outside the exit of the baggage area of the airport so it was very convenient. Look for a yellow ticket machine. Once you put your 3 euros in ( it gives change), validate it in another machine near it before the bus comes. When you arrive at Piazza Roma (very busy area) you have a decision to make before going to the hotel. How will you get there. We are in our 60's and pulling our luggage over 2 stepped bridges nearly killed us. If you are young, you could walk to the hotel. If not,. take a water taxi at the Piazza. ( Even young people were struggling with their luggage)
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

likes.liked: — Location to the Venice Grand Canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was fantastic and the room 411 overlooking the canal was so much fun. When you take a shower, you can open the bathroom window and look at the beautiful green dome right next to you. There are two windows that you can open over the canal and see and hear all of the action, but once you close the windows, we couldn't hear anything. Amazing! We could see the Railway Station right across the canal.
reviews.title: Great small hotel away from the madness

likes.liked: — Nice people; great location; view of canal from room; air conditioning..needed in Italy in June-July
likes.disliked: — Rooms a bit small...but typical of Italy...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast in the morning was typical European and we loved the little cappicino machine. Take your breakfast out to the tables in front of or the side of the hotel to eat. Don't miss the action. We couldn't understand why people would eat in the breakfast room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was outstanding and very pleasant. They answered any question you could think of and drew maps for anywhere. We can't say enough about the hotel and you won't be disappointed. My husband and I have traveled to Europe 5 times and would definitely stay at this hotel again. We paid about 300 euros a night for the room ( directly booked, but don't forget, you are on the canal and nothing is cheap in Venice).
reviews.title: A Great Hotel - go there!

likes.liked: — Friendly, extremely helpful staff. Good Breakfast
likes.disliked: — Lots of noise from the Grand Canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Going to the cruise ship, we shared a taxi with another couple we met a the hotel and then it was cheaper. Ask the desk if someone would need to also go to the ship. We paid 40 euros instead of 80 and it was well worth it. It is farther than you think to the cruise terminal if you have 2 suitcases a piece and dragging them over many steps on bridges. Have fun!
reviews.title: Impressive
Wonderful location
reviews.text: What a wonderful hotel...the whole experience was great, from check-in to check-out..... The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful with great information. I cannot say enough about the room. It was absolutely spotless, tastefully decorated and the bathroom was enormous. For the small added charge, the breakfast each morning was delightful. The location was excellent, quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of St. Mark's square, but still very convenient to all attractions. The water bus stop was a very short walk away....I would hightly recomment this hotel and can hardly wait for a return visit......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Antiche Figure on May 24th and 25th and I must say it far surpassed our expectations. We were on a two week trip through Italy, and this hotel was definitely the highlight. The rooms were beautifully decorated and immaculate. The staff were friendly and always helpful. The breakfast was the best of all the hotels we visited on our trip. The location of this hotel is perfect. If you arrive by train, you will see it accross the canal as soon as you step out of the train station and take in the beauty of Venice. I look forward to staying at this hotel again and again.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: we stayed at the beautiful Antiche Figure Hotel for 2 nights, May 23 and 24. I had been so excited to stay at this hotel, and was not disappointed! The room was simply gorgeous,
reviews.title: Absolute Perfection!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: large, beautifully furnished in venetion period style, and even had a murano glass chandelier over the king bed, as well as 3 murano glass sconces in the marble bathroom.
reviews.title: A trip to remember!
Small but perfectly formed
reviews.text: We had a canal view room on the third floor, with a lovely view of the bridge nearby, and the parade of gondolas and various other boats of every kind below. The hotel provided nightly turndown service, with lemoncello candies on our pillow, and the even laid out our jammies! (I thought that was a nice touch!) The breakfast was good, much like our other hotels in Italy, coffee, juice, yogurt, pastries, croissants, ham, cheese, cereals, etc.

reviews.title: hotel antiche figure
reviews.text: The rooms are very pretty and comfortable. It is my understanding that the Grand Canal side rooms are larger, and that was where we stayed both visits. The bathrooms are very nice, too, with a bathtub and shower and a nice sized vanity.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: We have just returned from 6 days at the Hotel Antiche Figure in Venice. Friends had warned us not to return to the same place/hotel (we first stayed there last year and liked it so much that we had booked again for this year) as they are never as good as you remember - they could not have been more wrong. This time we had booked the rooms overlooking the Grand Canal and it was worth every penny. In addition, the hotel and the staff were just as good as we remembered, if not better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated right on the Grand Canal close to all facilities, bridge, train, bus (water and auto), water taxi and gondola stations are all within easy reach. A lot of hotels claim to be on the canal, which they are, but not the Grand Canal, so be careful.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with exemplary staff
Super staff made my stay !
reviews.text: The Hotel Antiche Figure provides an excellent continental spread at breakfast time and although they do not provide evening meals this is not a problem as there are plenty of excellent restaurants close by, but be sure to ask the staff which they recommend, and be sure to follow their advice.

reviews.title: Loved the City. Loved the Hotel.
reviews.text: Selected based on reviews posted here. Enjoyed my stay in Venice and this hotel was a big reason.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: The city can be a little overwhelming when you get off the bus in the Piazzale Roma with large luggage. Thankfully the hotel is a quick walk - there are two little bridges, but overall easier than having to take a water bus/taxi.
reviews.title: Simply The Best!
Great hotel and best people
reviews.text: We had a great stay. Right by the train station and that was a blessing. The front desk so friendly. That made all the difference. They didn't nickle and dime us on anything. They loved their city and their work and it showed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We read Trip Advisor before booking the room and I must say that Im glad that we have found this little gem in Venice as we will return.
reviews.title: Thankyou Antiche Figure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo

reviews.title: Excellent base from which to explore Venice

likes.disliked: — Failure to inform me that the type of room I wanted had become available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this excellent hotel for a week and found the facilities excellent. Our room overlooking the Grand Canal was spacious and very well appointed. The breakfast buffet offered a great choice and was exceptionally reasonably priced. Best of all were the management and staff - friendly, helpful and always willing to go the extra mile for their guests.
reviews.title: AN ITALIAN DREAM

likes.liked: — Clean spacious room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: We were delighted to stay at this hotel. Location is very convenient to Venezia Santa Lucia train station and it was a great relief to get off the train, cross the bridge, and get to our hotel so fast. The reception staff was charming and very helpful. The room was very clean although not very spacious. Breakfast in the tables that face the canal was a big plus.
reviews.title: High marks to the Antiche Figure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I couldn't have been more happy with our choice of hotel in Venice. The hotel staff is very friendly and gives great advice on restaurants etc. Also, our booking didn't have breakfast, but they offered us to add the breakfast buffet anyway. For 5 Euro the breakfast included hardboiled eggs, cereals, pastries, juices and cold cuts and was a true bargain.
reviews.title: Eveerything great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently close to the train station if you want to take a train ride. It is also close to water bus (vaporetto) stops. Of course, most everything in Venice eg. St Marcus place is in walking distance anyway. Our room didn't have a view, but was big enough and very nicely furnitured. Also the bathroom was quite beautiful with the multi-colored tiles. Everything was vey clean.
reviews.title: Highly recommended - great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a construction project of the sewer system going on in the vicinity of the hotel right now and workers' voices did wake us up around 7 am, but this is obviously outside of the control of the hotel and wasn't a big deal.
reviews.title: WHAT ALL HOTELS SHOULD PROVIDE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on reviews here and on its location across from the train and vaporetto station. So glad we did. When we arrived we had no trouble crossing the bridge and finding our hotel which was right there on the Grand Canal. (Still perplexed at how one would drag luggage on the vaporetto or worse, walk through the winding streets of Venice, if one's hotel was some distance from the train station.) The staff was amazingly helpful, knowledgeable and patient and all spoke very good English. The room was very clean, though on the small side, quite luxurious and had a wonderful view of the canal. We could walk everywhere though it was quite a long walk to St Mark's. Highly recommended, though if you are looking for a very quiet location, this may be a little busy for you but we loved the convenience of the vaporetto station just across the bridge.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also stayed in this hotel as the start to our honeymoon before leaving for a mediterranean cruise. The staff could not be more helpful and polite. The hotel recently renovated an extension building (down a side alley/street) to the hotel with several suites, which we were offered to stay in for an extra 20 euros a night. We went for it and the rooms were great! Much larger than the rooms in the main hotel (which were also very nice, just much smaller).
reviews.title: Greay Stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: It is a short walk from Piazzale Roma where any land transfers take place. If you are looking for a hotel close to San Marco, this is not the one to stay in, but we found it very convenient and a nice walk. (You could also take the vaporetto from the stop right across the canal from the hotel - very convenient) The city is beautiful! I definitely recommend Antiche Figure.
reviews.title: A Lovely Place and Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After returning from our cruise in the Greek islands, we had just a few nights to see Venice. Hotel Antique Figure was the perfect location. We walked from the ship to the hotel and when we left to return to the states we walked to the station to catch the bus to Marco Polo airport. The hotel was lovely. The room was beautiful over looking the Grande Canal with a large spacious marble bathroom. But better than the accomodations and breakfast was the personal service we were given. Everyone was kind and helpful with plenty of advice and suggestions for where to go, and how to get there, from restaurants to tourist attractions. We had a wonderful experience and would recommend this hotel to all our friends!
reviews.title: Glorious Hotel

likes.liked: — Great room with a view, Staff, Location
likes.disliked: — Location, Breakfast nice, but a bit pricy

reviews.text: Max and Cynthia Pennsylvania, USA
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.liked: — Everything! Also the Staff are Great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: In addition to all the other comments made about this hotel, I feel that I would like to thank the breakfast lady for her excellent service. Our daughter who has a nut allergy wanted to eat one of the freshly baked croissants that were on the breakfast table. I checked first with the lady who was serving at breakfast and she didn't know if they contained nuts or not because they were supplied by a local bakery. She got straight on the phone to the bakery and spoke to the baker himself who was able to give her a list of all the ingredients. In this day and age of mass-produced food we were so impressed with being able to speak directly to the person who had baked the pastries. There is no way that you could do that in England--everything these days seems to come from some huge bakehouse and transported miles by road. I am sorry that I didn't get her name but that was first-class customer service. By the way, the hotel provides a splendid continental breakfast, with a wide choice of freshly produced breads, pastries, cakes and accompanying yoghurts, ham, cheese, cerial and fruit. Plus you can ask for a genuine Italian "latte" which comes in a glass!!
reviews.title: Excellent breakfast staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights on the 7th & 8th of September and absolutely loved it. We had a canal view room which I would highly recommend. The room was very nice and good sized as was the bath. There was a mini bar and nice toiletries for the bathroom, also houseslippers. The staff was excellent with very good English skills. The breakfast was not outstanding but was good by European standards. The hotel is right across the canal from the railroad station with a gondola station right in front of the hotel for 100 euros which was cheaper than the main tourist areas. An easy and delightful walk to the sights but be prepared to get lost, thats half the fun. We plan on staying here again on our next trip.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just got back yesterday and had spent three nights at the Hotel Antiche Figure. This is a little gem. I had a canal view on the first floor. It is busy and a lot of things happening out side your window which I actually liked. I stayed at the Westin in Florence for three nights and I actually prefered the charm of the AF. I would stay there again. I gave up on trying to find restuarants as recommended by tripadvisors. Seems like I would spend more time looking around for the restuarants and I would eventually end up at a restuarant that looked appealing. Stay a few minutes and look at the waiters attitudes. If I liked what I saw I would decide to eat there. There are several places in the back alley ways of the AF. Breakfast was not included in our package but they offered us a 5 euro per person deal being guests. Breakfast was continental but very well done. I fi booked again I would contact the hotel directly via email. The front desk english is excellent.
reviews.title: A little gem

likes.disliked: — Pricey drinks but on par with other hotels.

reviews.text: Across from the train station, we only needed to cross one bridge and walk 100m (100yds) to the hotel. Staff was cordial and very helpful. Our room was very nice and in the fall-off-season, reasonably priced.
reviews.title: delightful and easy to find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: With the vaporetto stops at the train station, access to Venice was also a snap. (recommend you try both directions and going West, ie to the right when @ the station, is the short trip to St. Marks :) )
reviews.title: Would love to return

likes.disliked: — bed was a little hard but no big deal

reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel pre and post cruise and loved it! We were moved to the hotel down the street (alley?) from the main hotel, which was fine with us. The rooms were larger than we booked and it was very quiet! I felt like we were staying in an apartment rather than a hotel. The location for us was great. Near the train station and Piazza Roma. It was a bit challenging at first to find the proper bridges to cross, but I did it alone with no map. Once I got the hang of navigating Venice, it was not bad. Close to vappereto stops too. Took the free shuttle to Murano, although I did not buy anything at the recommended store as it was lovely but expensive. We did purchase items at other locations.
reviews.title: Amazing - really top class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very accomodating and even carried our VERY HEAVY bags up to the third floor! We were able to check e-mail in the lobby for free as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Venice by train from Lucca. It was a fairly long trip and we had our big luggage with us. Once arriving at Santa Lucia Train Station in Venice we could see the hotel across the canal. We took one look at the large bridge we would have to cross with the bags and decided to make it easy on ourselves and hired a water taxi right away. They quickly hauled our bags and us across the canal right in front of the hotel. We were met by Johnny who took care of us for our 3 day stay.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Johnny recommended that we upgrade to room 511 which is what we did and what a great suite it was. We liked the sitting room with the sofa and extra desk, the bathroom was very spacious and the shower had some extra devices on it which made it more than just a shower.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Antique Figure has a very well thought out breakfast each morning - all I can say is it was one of the best breakfast's we had during our entire 12 days in Italy.
reviews.title: High marks for the Antiche Figure
