reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a double deluxe canal view room for 2 nights for the beginning of our honeymoon. Our check in was smooth and the front desk personnel were wonderful.
reviews.title: Just as good as everyone says!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: LOCATION: Superb! We came into Venice by train and the hotel is located directly across the canal from the train station. The most difficult portion is dragging two 50 lb luggage bag over the bridge. There are only steps, no smooth part to pull them! The other benefit of this location is that is located next to a vaperetto stop (water bus) that takes you wherever you want to go. If you desire to walk (which we did), it takes only about 20 minutes to walk to St. Marks Square and about 10 minutes to Rialto Bridge. Frankly you have so much fun walking you don't even notice the length!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, cannot wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: ROOM: Our room was very spacious for a European room. Beds were firm as to be expected, but fine. The view is really nice, but a little noisy in the morning with all of the water traffic. I really didn't care. The bathroom was great with a deep tub, double sinks, robes, and tons of hot water!
reviews.title: Fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FOOD: We didn't eat at the hotel. We ate in the town.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SERVICE: The front desk personnel are amazing! They wil help you find anything, explain how to get there in detail, and put it on a map. All of this will a pleasant, friendly attitude!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for the Saturday night after we left the cruise ship Splendour of the Seas. The hotel was just perfect for us and we had a beautiful room at the side of the hotel. It did not matter that we did not have a view as we were only staying the one night and had to leave early the next morning for the airport. We thought the hotel was one of the nicest we had stayed in and the breakfast was fine the next morning. All the staff were very pleasant, helpful and most obliging. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and if we visit Venice again we will stay there.
reviews.title: A perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Antiche Figure was perfect. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was darling. Great location. We are a family of four and were only staying for 1 night after our cruise. They had a room that had plenty of room for 4. Could not have been a better location. Close to everything yet away from the more congested areas. We are used to staying at 4 to 5 star hotels - we thought the cleanliness, accommodations and breakfast was right up there with the best.
reviews.title: Perfect location! Great Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used TripAdvisor with some trepidation to help us find a good hotel for our two night stay in Venice prior to a cruise. We were thrilled beyond words to find that everything we had read about the Antiche Figure hotel in this forum was accurate. The rooms (we traveled with another couple) were very nice, one was larger than the other, but the smaller one was still very functional. The decor was lovely, bathrooms especially. The rooms were very quiet, as well. The breakfast was quite good and could be eaten in either the breakfast room or outside right by the canal. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Definitely trust their restaurant recommendations, they were excellent. The hotel is a short walk (ten minutes max) from the Piazzelle Roma but it does require going over two bridges to get there, so pack accordingly! The hotel staff were able to direct us exactly to where the free bus was in Piazzelle Roma to take us to the cruise port. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to everyone, it has a wonderful charm about it and it's location, away from the busier parts of Venice and near the major port, make it ideal for cruisers.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

likes.liked: — Friendliness and knowledge of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at 10am thinking that we would have to drop our bags off and check in later in the day, but our room was ready and they allowed us to check in straight away. Our room was superb - overlooking the grand canal. It was huge and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and gave us lots of info on getting around, and even arranged a trip to Murano to see glass blowing, free of charge! We have stayed in many hotels in Europe and this has been the best so far, I would recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had a wonderful stay in this hotel. It is situated on the Grand Canal, very convenient to vaporetto stops and the railway station, and a great base to explore Venice. The staff were professional, charming and very Venetian (especially Alessandro....mmm...). The facilities were excellent: classy room, comfortable bed, a roomy bathroom with drying facilities (it rains alot in Venice...), free internet, good breakfast (the best soft-boiled eggs), and competent airconditioning. I enjoyed every minute at this hotel, and I found myself looking forward to getting away from the crowds to relax in my room. When I needed help with tours, again the staff were very helpful. I plan to return here, it is good value for money and I thoroughly recommend it.
reviews.title: A Classy Stay

We were given a beautiful ttriple room with a tiny balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. What a view to have for our first, but certainly not last, visit to Venice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and the bathroom large and well-equipped with two sinks. The breakfast room was a bit small, but the food was good. There are also several tables outside which can provide a good spot for people watching or just sipping a cocktail from the hotel bar after a day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is across from the train station and just a couple of blocks from the Piazzale Roma. Very convenient for travelers. It is about 25 minutes stroll to San Marco, but there is much less traffic and the prices for accommodations and food are cheaper in the area around the hotel. Let me say that Venice is NOT a cheap place to stay, but if you order meals carefully, you can avoid breaking the bank.
reviews.title: Weekend to remember

likes.liked: — The staff was well-trained and very attentive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, the stay at the Antiche Figure was very enjoyable and I would suggest it for travelers to Venice.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed in! My husband took me as a 40th birthday present and we chose the hotel on the strength of trip advisor reviews and we found them to be very accurate. Its location is perfect - just opposite the railway and vaporetto stations and only a short walk from the bus station- believe me when you're carrying luggage it's a brilliant place to be! We had a side room (314) which was a bit small, but beautifully appointed with fabric walls, murano glass chandelier and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in on holiday. The bathroom was beautiful and the towels were changed daily. I would say not having a room overlooking the canal was an advantage because the traffic on the canal can be noisy and is ceaseless - think of the M25! The staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful but not intrusive - spending time with you on arrival advising you of places to go and where to eat and will book tickets for concerts or the doges palace for you. Take advantage of this as we never got to the basilica because of the queues.
reviews.title: Small, wonderful hotel with super location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our room faced the grand canal. It was very clean, good size and well soundproofed so we couldn't hear any of the boat/pedestrian traffic just below our window. Staff was excellent and attentive. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
